interventions.Card Description:
'- Begin on your hands and knees in a tabletop position.  
   - Inhale as you arch your back and lift your head and tailbone (Cow Position).  
   - Exhale as you round your back and tuck your chin to your chest (Cat Position).  
   - Repeat for 5-10 breaths to release tension and increase awareness.

'- Sit back on your heels, and fold your torso forward, resting your forehead on the mat.  
   - Extend your arms forward or place them alongside your body.  
   - Focus on your breath, and hold for 1-3 minutes to promote relaxation.

'- Stand tall and balance on one leg.  
   - Place the sole of the opposite foot on your inner thigh or calf (avoid the knee).  
   - Bring your hands to prayer position or raise them overhead.  
   - Focus on balance and grounding yourself, holding the pose for 30 seconds to 1 minute on each side.

'- Lie on your back and extend your legs up against a wall.  
   - Relax your arms at your sides, with palms facing up.  
   - Stay in this position for 5-15 minutes to improve circulation and calm the nervous system.

'- Sit comfortably, close your eyes, and take a few deep breaths.  
   - Focus on the sensation of your breath entering and leaving your nostrils.  
   - Whenever your mind wanders, gently bring your attention back to your breath.  
   - Practice for 5-10 minutes daily.

'- Lie down comfortably and close your eyes.  
   - Starting from your toes, slowly bring your attention to each part of your body, noticing any sensations.  
   - Move progressively up to your head, relaxing each area as you go along.  
   - This practice can take 10-20 minutes and helps increase body awareness and relaxation.

'- Sit comfortably with your eyes closed.  
   - Repeat phrases such as “May I be happy, may I be healthy, may I be safe, may I live with ease” for yourself.  
   - Gradually extend these wishes to loved ones, acquaintances, and even those with whom you have difficulties.  
   - Practice for 10-15 minutes to cultivate compassion and positivity.

'- Designate a specific time each day to disconnect from digital devices.  
   - Use this time to sit, breathe, and reflect on your intentions for using social media.  
   - Consider journaling about your experiences and insights during this detox period.
